meanings.definition: Having or showing an attitude of superiority or disdain.
meanings.sent1: She always acts sniffier than everyone else in the class.
meanings.sent2: The cat gave a sniffier look to the new kitten.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gave a sniffier glance at the acorn, thinking it was too small for him.
meanings.sent4: Her sniffier tone made it clear she thought she was better than the rest.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee's sniffier behavior made the other bees feel inferior.

meanings.definition: To sniff repeatedly or audibly, typically due to a cold or allergies.
meanings.sent1: He was sniffier all day because of his cold.
meanings.sent2: The dog sniffiered around the garden, searching for a bone.
meanings.sent3: The elephant sniffiered loudly, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The detective sniffiered the air, trying to catch the scent of the criminal.
meanings.sent5: She sniffiered the flowers, enjoying their sweet fragrance.
